project.teaser: According to the EU’s Climate Adaptation Strategy (COM(2021) 82), “improving knowledge and managing uncertainty” is key for realising the vision of a climate neutral and climate-resilient Union, as “Climate change is having such a pervasive impact that our response to...
project.objective:
According to the EU’s Climate Adaptation Strategy (COM(2021) 82), “improving knowledge and managing uncertainty” is key for realising the vision of a climate neutral and climate-resilient Union, as “Climate change is having such a pervasive impact that our response to it must be systemic”. Thus, there is an urgent need for an integrated approach for an enhanced understanding of the interaction, complementarity and trade-offs between adaptation and mitigation measures, especially regarding the expected increase in region-al mean temperature, precipitation and changing soil moisture (IPCC AR6 WG I). Furthermore, this under-standing and knowledge needs to be provided to a broad audience to support local authorities in EU partner countries in developing regional programmes.
KNOWING aims to develop a modelling framework to help understand and quantify the interactions between impacts and risks of climate change, mitigation pathways and adaptation strategies. The framework will be used to assess thAdvancing climate science and further broadening and deepening the knowledge base is essential to inform the societal transition towards a climate neutral and climate resilient society by 2050, as well as towards a more ambitious greenhouse gas reduction target by 2030. There is a need for research that furthers our understanding of past, present and expected future changes in climate and its implications on ecosystems and society, closing knowledge gaps, and develops the tools that support policy coherence and the implementation of effective mitigation and adaptation solutions. Currently, there is a lack of knowledge of the Earth system and the ability to predict and project its changes under different natural and socio-economic drivers, especially regarding complex interrelations, rebound effects and behavioural aspects. Therefore, a holistic, system-aware and behaviour centred approach is needed to identify and implement realistic and effective climate mitigation pathways.
project.title: Framework for defining climate mitigation pathways based on understanding and integrated assessment of climate impacts, adaptation strategies and societal transformation
project.keywords: Model Framework, Societal Transformation, Mitigation pathways, Adaptation-mitigation trade-offs

article.title: Filling knowledge gaps to reach climate neutrality

programme.title: Better understanding of the interactions between climate change impacts and risks, mitigation and adaptation options

category.title: Topic
category.description: Programme: Part of the Commission work programme implementing legal basis

result.title: KNOWING Playful Trainings
result.description: The Deliverable contains user guides and descriptions of the beta version of web-based trainings developed in Task T4.3 for specific stakeholder groups, e.g. to support local planners in consulting local businesses (e.g. planners consulting farmers) or to communicate policy decisions and measures to stakeholders and citizens.

result.title: KNOWING App
result.description: Beta version of multilingual KNOWING App developed in Task T4.3 for citizens and stakeholders. The app (downloadable Climate Interaction Knowledge Base (KER1) and via the KNOWING Hubs, including user guide) helps to decipher the complex interrelationships of the causes and effects of different climate impacts and countermeasures in an interactive and engaging way.

result.title: Chancen durch den Rückbau von Entwässerungsstrukturen.

details.authors: Nieder, R., Y. Burkhardt, A. Mork, S.E. Slembrouck und J. Weber

result.title: Knowledge Calendar and Archive
result.description: This Deliverable related to Task T5.4 comprises a database and structured collection of dissemination measures including post-assessment of measures which will be updated every 12 months.

result.title: CIC-related Measures Inventory
result.description: Report comprising the categorised demonstrator specific adaptation/mitigation measures and interactions based on the the screening results in Task T1.2 and the feedback provided by the EEAB.

result.title: EEAB & SRG Recommendations
result.description: Coordinated under Task T6.1, this report summarises the recommendations and the feedback provided by the advisory bodies EEAB and SRG during the past Reporting Period and how these have been considered. The report will be updated at the end of each Reporting Period.

result.title: Qualitative Interactive Model
result.description: The Deliverable consist of a graphical representation of the Qualitative interactive System Dynamics Model developed in Task T2.1 in form of a Causal Loop Diagram. The Diagram will be integrated in the Climate Interaction Knowledge Base (KER1, D1.4) and can be accessed online.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - KNOWING (Framework for defining climate mitigation pathways based on understanding and integrated assessment of climate impacts, adaptation strategies and societal transformation)
result.teaser: The climate system provides the conditions for all living beings to thrive. Human actions during the last centuries though are increasingly disrupting the delicate balance of the climate system, threatening the survival of both humans and countless species. Consequently, also...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: KNOWING Exploitation Plan
result.description: This report summarises Task T5.5 activities and lists planned exploitation measures and guidelines for implementation. The focus lies especially on the main developments of models and tools achieving TRL leaps during the project, in particular the Qualitative Interactive Model (D2.1), the Impact Interaction Model Framework (KER2; D2.4), theImpact Coping Behaviour Model (component of D1.3), the KNOWING Decision Support Service (DSS) (D4.7) and the KNOWING App (D4.4). It is updated at the end of each Reporting Period.

result.title: Data Management Plan
result.description: The Data Management Plan is developed from the draft concept in Task T6.6 and defines on data management and accessibility during the project lifetime as well as post project use of datasets. It is updated at the end of each Reporting Period.

result.title: Fichtenkalamität: ökologische Folgen und Chancen für die Nachhaltigkeit

details.authors: Nieder, R., Y. Burkhardt, A. Mork und S.E. Slembrouck

result.title: KNOWING Innovation Catalogue
result.description: This Deliverable is based on the activities in Task T6.5 and provides an overview of innovative leaps achieved in the project as well as insights and learnings from other projects, evolving needs and emerging technologies which have influenced the course of the project implementation. The catalogue will summarise the achievements of each project year and presented on the project web site.

result.title: Impact Interaction Model Framework
result.description: This Deliverable consists of a description of the now calibrated SD Model with interfaces to different sector models (D2.2) and how to access it and couple sector models. The framework is open-source and will be further developed based on the modelling results and CIC insights from WP3. The SD Model and interfaces codes will be made accessible via the Climate Interaction Knowledge Base (D1.4).

result.title: Windenergie aus dem Wald (I): negative Auswirkungen minimieren.

details.authors: Nieder, R., Y. Burkhardt, A. Mork, S.E. Slembrouck und S. Weber

result.title: KNOWING Qualitative SD Model including examples of measures for each CIC

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
